,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a fabulous time at Thomas's house over Labor day weekend. Thomas was a great host- very fast to respond, so accommodating and a breeze to work with. The house was just as described and easy to find. The kitchen was well stocked with basic supplies and dishes. The outside of the house has a nice fire pit with wood supplied, a large picnic table and a grill and is a beautiful place to sit and enjoy the birds in the morning with a coffee. The location was a 10 minute ride to the Comedy Museum and 20 minutes from hiking at Panama Rocks. A Bob Evans and McDonalds are conveniently located just around the corner and down the road from the house. There are also several nice restaurants around the lake with outdoor dining on the water. We didn't get a chance to walk the nature path nearby but we did take a late-night walk through the cemetery and saw lots of deer there. Altogether, we had a lovely time at this property and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

review_text: My husband and I booked this airbnb for the weekend with our kids and loved it! The house had a very modern feel with cute decorations throughout. It was obvious that the owner had comfort in mind while choosing items for the house from soft throw blankets to puzzles and cards available for some down time. It was big enough for my husband and I to hang in the living room while our kids had their own space to play and also had a large sofa in the living room where we were all able to enjoy a movie. It was a 5 minute drive to the closest Tim Hortons and a 10 minute drive to Wegmans/Target/Starbucks which was also right next to Lake Chautauqua. A previous review mentioned the proximity to the hospital and we also did not hear any sirens or traffic day or night during our stay. One of the best parts was the updated bathroom with large soaker tub that our kids had the pleasure of using. We will definitely be booking again!

This place was a great find. Lori is an excellent host. The refrigerator is stocked with basics for breakfast and including several local beers was a nice touch. Loved the vibe of the loft. Very nice job of making it feel new and modern without losing the charm of a historic building. The kitchen was well equipped if you are planning on cooking.
Convenient location with a grocery store just up the road. Easy to get into town. You can be in the heart of downtown Jamestown in under 10 minutes. We went to the National Comedy Center and the Lucille Ball Desi Arnaz museum. Both were a great experience.
It was the beginning of April when we were there, so it was still cold outside. All of the warm blankets Lori provided were nice touch for relaxing on the couch and watching some tv when we came back after going out to dinner. This is the perfect place for a couple to get away for a weekend or a longer vacation. It was quiet and bed was very comfortable. Definitely the most comfortable bed we have had while travelling. We would definitely stay here again if we come back to Jamestown.

There was a power outage the first night of our stay, and Lori was quick to provide information on when to expect the issue to be solved and also extra candles/flashlights. It was very obvious that Lori strives to make your stay as relaxing and carefree as possible. The trolley station loft is one of the top Airbnb places that we have stayed in. We highly recommend this special place for anyone traveling to Lake Chatauqua or surrounding areas.

Hello, traveler:
There is one problem with this listing: The real experience is MUCH better than the listing! The photos canâ€™t quite capture/replicate what it feels like to be in the space.
Seriously, this is one of... if not the best... AirBnB experience to date, for us.
The setting: A respite. An oasis. Weâ€™re city dwellers and Loriâ€™s place was just what we needed. Farm across the street with budding corn. 1970 LTD parked nearby. Church diagonally located. Green grass and pastures abounding. History. Brick details. A lovely gift shop. Mourning doves. Humming birds. Much more.
Design: Loriâ€™s got talent. Such sophistication and refinementâ€”yet comfort.
Thoughtfulness: Get ready. Anything. Truly anything one could need: Cosmetics, food, drinks, utensils, ++, ++, ++. Want to cook? Loriâ€™s place a place to do so. Donâ€™t want to? Plenty of other options.
Deck: Resort quality. Lighting. Outdoor furniture. Grille.
Cleanliness: YES.
Loriâ€™s flat invites you inâ€¦ and embraces you in comforting luxury.
Regrets? We only stayed one night ğŸ˜•.

review_text:
A MUST STAY AT PROPERTY !!!!
This loft is amazing we have stayed at tons of AIRBNB'S but none that were ever this well equipped. We walked in to a welcome note and candies a great personal touch by Lori. The fridge and cupboards were all stocked for everything you could want to make breakfast, she even left a couple local beers if you wanted to try them. Keurig coffee pot with several coffee choices, many extras like French vanilla creamer, half and half, Starbucks caramel splash etc etc. I was blow away by the thought of details put into this loft.
Everything was spotless and tastefully decorated, very cool vibe great wood floors, brick walls just a very homey feel. The bathroom had everything you needed for your stay plenty of towels and wash clothes shampoo, conditioner. body wash etc etc, and the shower is roomy and good water pressure.
The lift is basically for a single person to rent, or a couple as there is 1 bedroom but very big, if you have a small child they could sleep on couch or floor in sleeping bag.
Lori also owns a super cure store below the loft that carries tons of candles, as well as different, unique pieces, something for every occasion and for both men and woman.
There is also a back covered porch you can use with a BBQ grill and chairs with cushions super chill.
I could go on and on about this place but just take my word you will not be disappointed worth every penny, and close to grocery, gas, dollar stores. and restaurants.

review_text: My girlfriend and I had an excellent weekend experience, thanks to our host, Lori. The loft is very tastefully restored and decorated, Lori's thoughtful touches were extremely welcoming and amenities were carefully and comprehensively provided. If anything, we felt that the loft exceeded our expectations based on the photos - it's beautiful! As hosts ourselves, we are encouraged to "up" our game and incorporate some of the hospitality tips that we learned from Lori. The location is excellent, just minutes from conveniences in downtown Jamestown but private in a quaint countryside setting. We had an excellent Valentine's dinner at Forte, enjoyed the Winter Festival in Mayville and spent some time trying some of the beers and cocktails that Southern Tier Brewery and Distillery had to offer. Lori's recommendations in the Local Guide were spot on! Lori was communicative and warm, and check-in on a keypad was a snap. There was very little room for ambiguity in terms of parking, location, etc. She left us some Valentine's candy and a personal note, which was much appreciated. We will be talking about the loft for some time and will certainly be recommending it to others. And perhaps we'll come to visit again, maybe during warm weather to enjoy more of the outdoor activities in the area (the lake, etc). Highly recommend!

All-in-all a great trip and fantastic space!

The apartment is in a central location, great for visiting family and for walking to restaurants and attractions. We enjoyed morning walks along the river, something I never did when I lived in Jamestown! A pass is provided for the parking garage next to the unit; metered spaces on the road are free nights and weekends. We could clearly see our car from the window, a fact I was grateful for when I couldn't remember if I'd closed the trunk.
We've already recommended this place to friends and family, and we're looking forward to returning some day.

review_text: We had a wonderful one-night stay at this exceptional Airbnb space. The hosts had great---and even personalized---attention to detail, and the loft is extremely clean, stylish, and spacious. It is in an excellent downtown location, walkable to the main things Jamestown has to offer, including the National Comedy and Lucy/Desi museums (which we were unable to visit this time, but highly recommend to all based on past experience). There were lots of thoughtful amenities and extras. Though with our short overnight stay we did not use most of them, the hosts seem to have thought of everything, including super-soft towels, lovely linens, a well-equipped and beautiful kitchen, a sound machine, charging devices, lighted makeup mirror (in a lovely dressing room), local travel and history books, umbrellas, extra tooth paste, a selection of snacks and coffee, and even a record player with records. I am sure I am still missing many other special treats, but suffice to say it is far beyond what you will find at most Airbnbs. The only downside is that we didn't stay longer, but we hope to come back in the future.

When you were in one of the bedrooms, it was nearly impossible to hear people talking or listening to music downstairs. We were there for one Saturday night when the bar and restaurant were open, and while we could hear noise, it wasn't intrusive. On our last morning, the restaurant smoke alarm went off briefly very early (which brought the emergency vehicles), but thankfully the building was cleared right away and deemed safe. Jonathan was quick to send a gift card as an apology for the inconvenience, something we hadn't expected but spoke to his hospitality and thoughtfulness. The apartment was a very comfortable home away from home, and we look forward to returning.

Jonathan was super responsive and helpful. Great location if youâ€™re in town to visit the Lucy Desi Museum, Comedy Center, etc. Parking was convenient on street and in the parking garage up the street. Really cheap parking and free on weekends in the garage. Everything was walkable. House was reasonably clean, but has many quirks due to age. Lots of stairs. Lots and lots of stairs. Very steep and narrow stairs, so anyone that has difficulty walking up stairs will have a LOT of trouble. Beds were comfortable and clean. All of the Rooms and bedrooms were a good size. The kitchen is smaller but has many amenities. The bathroom door doesnâ€™t stay closed upstairs, but you can easily put the stool against it to keep it closed.
TVs in both rooms, but not down in the family room, but not a deal breaker. We enjoyed the art and homey feel of the apartment.
Sauce is a great restaurant for dinner and literally around the corner. Labyrinth was awesome too! Thank you again to Jonathan!

October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Inspiring style in a great location! My sister-in-law and I took my mum and our 4 little girls on an I Love Lucy pilgrimage to Jamestown and Jonathan's AirBnb apartment was the perfect location, size and style to make it a memorable and seamless trip! Jonathan was so accommodating, quick to respond, and the decor was so trendy and historic at the same time. We all felt completely welcome, and there were so many thoughtful touches. The 2-storey apartment was spacious and even boasted the biggest, most comfortable blow-up bed you could imagine! Thank you to Jonathan and his co-hosts for making our stay perfect. The I Love Lucy board game was the icing on the cake!
In terms of Jamestown itself, we did find it hard to find a restaurant or things to do outside of all the Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz historic sites. We ended up picking up pizza and doing without wine after several attempts on Sunday evening to find a restaurant or good take out with wine.
That said, the surrounding nature was gorgeous, especially on a wonderful fall weekend in October.

We booked in a hurry based solely on the reviews that mentioned the comfortable bed (in a convenient geographical location between our origin and destination of course), but I hadnâ€™t realized how spacious it is, too. I wish I had taken a moment more to figure out there isnâ€™t on site overnight parking ($5/day at the parking garage down the block, not bad), and that most of the cafes/ bars/ restaurants mentioned in other reviews donâ€™t appear to be open on Sunday nights or Monday mornings â€” but thats on me! This was an oasis on our very long drive and Jonathan was a super nice and responsive host who provided everything we needed for our stay.

The apartment really celebrates the local life with brochures, the Airbnb listing has ideas on what to do/eat, local art work, even the mattresses (which were very comfortable) were bought local. It was an experience being in a downtown apartment with levels. There are numerous stairs to the first level of apartment and up to the bedrooms - but do not let this deter you from choosing this location. You can feel at home in this apartment.

name: Alistair

February 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Lovely two-storey townhouse with an exterior and architecture that channels 19th century France and interior decor that channels 1920s-40s America. An incredible amount of attention and detail went into the selection of every piece of artwork, furniture, and decoration, and Jonathan deserves commendation for it.
To discuss substance as well as style, the apartment was thoughtfully laid out (living and dining rooms downstairs, bedrooms upstairs) and the beds and furniture were all extremely comfortable. The full kitchen (including dishwasher) and in-unit washer/dryer were handy for the more practical aspects of our stay. And the location was a short walk to almost anything in downtown Jamestown, from numerous cute restaurants (of which there will be even more post-COVID, I am sure) to the National Comedy Center (a must-visit, and really do plan to spend minimum 2 hours there).
Last but certainly not least, Jonathan was extremely responsive (3 mins!) to all messages and queries, and no question was too large or too small for him to answer quickly and thoughtfully. His hospitality made our stay a seamless and pleasant one.
Highly recommend if you are ever in - or looking to make a long weekend visit to - the area!

Great location in downtown Jamestown. The apartment is huge! And great windows for a lot of natural light. It is up 2 staircases- not difficult but good to keep in mind for anyone who isn't too mobile. Comfortable furniture, washer & dryer, kitchen tools are all there!
Unfortunately with covid many places are closed but Sprinkle Cone is open every day! And some restaurants are available for takeout

name: AnnMarie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
August 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The apartment has a great view of Jamestown! Our pup loved looking out the ceiling to floor windows at everyone walking by on the sidewalk. Great spot for walking around the downtown area and river walk. Convenient area to drive to hiking spots within a half hour. The mattress was super comfortable in the room we slept in.
The parking situation is 2 hour street parking during business hours, we were able to park on the street overnight without being ticketed but the signs do say "No Standing" between 2:00am and 7:00am, seems that the city doesn't enforce either of the rules from what we saw. There was a meter lot across the side street and a parking garage a block down, not sure what the situation was for either overnight. There is no actual "Free parking on premises" as stated in the listing so may just need to look into those other off-street parking options if that is a concern for you.
